SENT.plain: Arterial complications of Behçet's disease are rare and affect mainly the aorta and iliac arteries
Perforation of the arterial wall is the most common lesion, predisposing to false aneurysm or rupture
Open surgical repair is difficult, and anastomotic false aneurysms often occur because of aortic wall fragility
We report here the case of using a bifurcated stent to treat aortoiliac false aneurysms in a 37-year-old patient
Endovascular repair could be an alternative treatment of aneurysmal manifestations in Behçet's disease
